The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group Dear Parents, Hopefully you all had a wonderful break and are looking forward to all that Term Three has on offer! Last term was short but busy and now we are in our last term of the academic year. We had some awesome events in Term Two that everyone enjoyed such as: World Maths Day, Art Week, Russian celebration and ISM has Talent. We have lots of learning to do in our last term as well as enjoying the various events we have going on in Term 3. We are sure that Term Three will be as successful as the previous two, rounding the year off nicely. Summer Term Dates (12 weeks / 60 days) Monday 8th April - First day back. Tuesday 23rd April – After School Activities Begin. Thursday 2nd May – Lower School Music Concert Monday 6th May – Friday 10th May Half term (return Monday 13th May)
Tuesday 28th May – Golf begins (3 weeks) Monday 27th May – Friday 31st May (Assessment Week) Thursday 30th May – Art Exhibition Monday 3rd June – Thursday 6th June (Tottenham Hotspur Football camp) Tuesday 11th and Wednesday 12th June - Last days of ASAs Wednesday 26th June - Year 2 Production (9.15am) Thursday 27th June - Year 2 Production (6pm) Tuesday 2nd and Wednesday 3rd July - Parent-teacher Consultations 4-6pm Friday 5th July – Speech Day at the Hotel Marriot Grand Reminders: ISM is a ‘Nut Free’ school, please ensure that none of the snacks the children bring into school have nuts in them (this includes birthday cakes) and of course that they are healthy (no chocolate, sweets or crisps please). Thank-you! In Year 2 we value the importance of protecting the environment and strongly advise parents to send their child to school with a water bottle every day. Also, please continue to wait outside for your child to come to you at the end of the day as the locker rooms get overcrowded when parents and drivers come in to help children get ready (Please remind your drivers of this). Uniform: Due to the weekly class uniform certificate I am glad to say that in general the children’s uniform has improved this year. Please continue to support us with this and refer back to the blue parent/student handbook to see exactly what your child should wear Eg. black leather shoes except on PE days when trainers are to be worn. ICT: Please remind your children to use Purplemash.com at home and to complete the weekly ‘mymaths’ challenges that are sent home once a week. Also, don’t forget to check out the ‘App of the Week’ that is added to the weekly blurb. As always, many thanks to you for all your support and I hope that your children will enjoy their last term in Year 2! Yours Sincerely, The Year 2 Team Mrs. Arora (Teacher 2A) Mr. Grange (TA) Miss. Salter (Teacher 2B) Mrs. Mason (TA) Miss Gaskin (Teacher 2C) Mr. Chapman (TA) Mr. Charlton (Year 1, 2 & 3 Phase Leader) Mrs. Doubleday (academic coordinator) Year 2 Curriculum coverage for this term Literacy Narrative: Identifying features common to an author’s work, understanding the differences between written and spoken text and writing extended stories. Reports: Identifying fact/fiction, finding, recording and presenting factual information. EAL Spelling and phonics skills, vocabulary improvement, appropriate use of past tense. Maths We will look at giving change, place value concepts for 3 digit numbers, doubling, multiples of 2, 5 and 10, symmetry and the creation of symmetrical shapes, using different measures for capacity, measuring time and division. We will also be applying skills to real life problems. We will also review adding/subtracting two digit numbers and making use of number bonds to ten. Art Exploring buildings and constructing a lighthouse using different materials. Investigating the work of Claude Monet and painting an artistic picture using the artists’ painting style. Developing observational drawing skills and showing an awareness of objects having a third dimension. Russian Advanced Group Basic knowledge about parts of speech (noun, adjective, verb). Learn how to check the spelling of words. Intermediate Food, complex sentences and pronouns. Beginners: My Town (directions, weather, places) Music Children will be learning to play the ocarina. They will perform well known songs in unison and in parts. The remainder of the term will be spent preparing songs and music with actions for the production. ICT Photo and video multimedia using computers, cameras and iPads. Questions and answers, using a branching Database. PE The students will practice the basic skills of throwing, catching and hitting during a variety of modified games. During Athletics, the children will enhance their techniques in movement, allowing them to transfer these to a range of Athletic events. During OAA (Outdoor Adventurous Activities), the children will develop their understanding of how to solve a variety of problems by enhancing their communication skills and working together in small teams. PSHE Caring for one another The environment Cooperation Safety at Home Integrated Curriculum (This subject combines skills from PSHE, Cultural Studies, Science and Humanities) Dinosaurs! This term we are exploring dinosaurs and their extinction through the creation of an ebook on the IPads. This is an exciting new topic which will allow the children to explore technology whilst creating their own book with pictures, words and oral recordings. IT’S ALIVE! All things creepy crawly, mini beasts studying and comparing them, examining life cycles, living things in our environments, habitats and to know that they are different varieties of animals and caring for the environment.
